Articles.Content:
Sector 7 Space Laboratories
Aircraft Repository

Here you will find many Aircraft builds I've posted in the past, you can find the original links, craft files, videos and pictures here. As craft are posted in the future I will periodically update the Thread. Some builds are old ones and I have updated pictures and links, if you see one that is not posted message me about it and I will gladly get it posted. I would also like to thank everyone that have downloaded any of my builds and hope that you have enjoyed them as much as I have enjoyed building, flying, driving, launching, diving, steering and crashing them with you.

 

 

Today's Featured Aircraft
Terrafugia Transition 7

 

Another casual flying Aircraft. The original craft is a flying car that is propelled with a propeller and also folding wings. This one has lots of hang time when landing and will stall near 40 m/s. The fuel can be maxed out but sliding may occur. The wheels I am using make the craft look more like the real craft but having no breaks and using the Engines Reverse makes it a fun challenge when landing on the Island Airbase.

Craft File: Terrafugia Transition 7
Parts: 35
Mass: 7.810t
Height: 3.3m
Width: 10.3m
Length: 9.5m

Operation: At Takeoff apply full Throttle and SAS and flaps if desired (Action Group 3). The craft will fly nicely with or without SAS but much better with it.

Action Groups
1- Toggle Engine (Off / On)
2- Toggle Engine Reverse
3- Toggle Landing Flaps

 

Craft File: Softwind 107

Spoiler

 

This one is for all you casual Fly Boys! The craft has been really fun to fly, it's very graceful and has lots of hang time when landing. Add more fuel for distance trips.

Craft File: Softwind 107
Parts: 32
Mass: 5.134t
Height: 2.2m
Width: 10.8m
Length: 8.5m

Operation: At Takeoff engage SAS and apply full Throttle, when landing reduce speed and AG2 for Flaps.

Action Groups
1- Toggle Engines
2- Toggle Landing Flaps ( Got this little tip from @Azimech )
3- Toggle Landing Lights

Mrs. Chrissy Too

The Mrs. Chrissy Too is a modified Mrs. Chrissy Biplane, converted into a Seaplane. She comes off of the water with ease and very slow stall speed helps with the landings.

 

Spoiler

Parts: 84
Mass: 6.510t
Height: 4.0m
Width: 7.7m
Length: 8.2m

Edited January 27, 2017 by Castille7

S7X1

I saw a B52 Bomber built by @Servo Servo and thought to shine a little light on his craft. I designed the S7X1 small enough to fit in it's cargo bay and fast enough to embarrass FedEx on small package delivery!  

I've also had an Uncle that was a casualty in WWII but never knew how he died, I recently found out he was shot down in one of these B-52 Bombers. Just thought I would share this on this post sense this all seems to be coming together at the same time.

 

 

Note: The craft file is only the S7X1
Craft File: S7X1
Parts: 18
Mass: 5.405t
Height: 2.9m
Width: 2.7m
Length: 6.7m

Servo's B52 Bomber can be found here and his Craft File: B-52 Stratofortress

 

Edited January 30, 2017 by Castille7

Very nice little craft! And thanks for the shout-out, of course.

You are very welcome, beautiful work on the cockpit and wings, had to share it! Also I am using MAGIX Movie Edit Pro 17 Plus, it's a European Product out of Berlin, I love their products and Xara, they are affiliated.

've also had an Uncle that was a casualty in WWII but never knew how he died, I recently found out he was shot down in one of these B-52 Bombers. Just thought I would share this on this post sense this all seems to be coming together at the same time

You sure it wasn't a B-25? B-52s were definitely not in service in WWII. No disrespect towards your uncle, of course.

You sure it wasn't a B-25? B-52s were definitely not in service in WWII. No disrespect towards your uncle, of course. 

Ok thank you for the heads up on that one , It was WWII that's where I found him in my research, I notice someone else had mentioned 52, It was probably the B-25 Here is where I found him. I love Aircraft and got this from my Dad who served in the Air Force but i never studied all the WWII Aircraft until now.
